metadata.title: CVE-2016-4055 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The duration function in the moment package before 2.11.2 for Node.jsallows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) viaa long string, aka a "regular expression Denial of Service (ReDoS)."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4055` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjs-moment - 2.11.0+ds-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
node-moment - 2.11.0+ds-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: node-moment package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.11.0+ds-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
